name: Heavy Duty: Consolidation
description: Mentzer's famous 'Ideal Routine' - the ultimate in training economy. Just 5 exercises, hitting every major muscle group. Only train this 1x per week (or even less). Maximum results, minimum time.

exercises.name: Mentzer's Most Controversial Routine
exercises.notes: This is HIGH INTENSITY training taken to its logical conclusion. 5 exercises, 1 set each, to absolute failure. Train ONCE per week or LESS. Sounds too little? Try it - the intensity makes up for the volume.
Just enough to break a sweat. Save energy for the working sets.
1 warmup set. 1 ALL-OUT set to absolute failure. Full range of motion. 4-2-4 tempo.
1 warmup set. 1 ALL-OUT set. Full stretch at bottom. 4-2-4 tempo. To FAILURE.
1 warmup set. 1 ALL-OUT set. Squeeze shoulder blades. 4-2-4 tempo. To FAILURE.
1 working set. Full range of motion. 4-2-4 tempo. To FAILURE.
The grand finale. 1 working set. Full body engagement. 4-2-4 tempo. To FAILURE.

tips: This routine is NOT for beginners - you need to know how to truly train to failure
5 sets total. That's it. If you need more, you're not training hard enough.
WAIT 7+ DAYS between sessions. Mentzer trained some clients only once every 2 weeks.
Progressive overload: add weight or reps each session. If you can't progress, you're overtraining.
This works because intensity trumps volume. 1 set at 100% effort beats 10 sets at 50%.
